org.gradoop.storage.accumulo.impl

Class AccumuloEPGMStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.storage.accumulo.impl.AccumuloEPGMStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, EPGMConfigProvider<GradoopAccumuloConfig>, EPGMGraphInput, EPGMGraphOutput, EPGMGraphPredictableOutput<AccumuloElementFilter<EPGMGraphHead>,AccumuloElementFilter<EPGMVertex>,AccumuloElementFilter<EPGMEdge>>

    public class AccumuloEPGMStore
extends Object
implements EPGMConfigProvider<GradoopAccumuloConfig>, EPGMGraphInput, EPGMGraphPredictableOutput<AccumuloElementFilter<EPGMGraphHead>,AccumuloElementFilter<EPGMVertex>,AccumuloElementFilter<EPGMEdge>>
    Default Accumulo EPGM graph store that handles reading and writing vertices and graphs from and to Accumulo, It is designed thread-safe. Store contains instances are divided by GradoopAccumuloConfig.ACCUMULO_TABLE_PREFIX
    See Also:
    EPGMGraphPredictableOutput

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccumuloEPGMStore

        public AccumuloEPGMStore(@Nonnull
                         GradoopAccumuloConfig config)
                  throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException,
                         org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException
        Creates an AccumuloEPGMStore based on the given parameters. Tables with given prefix will be auto-create if not exists
        Parameters:
        config - accumulo store configuration
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException - for security violations, authentication failures, authorization failures, etc.
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException - generic Accumulo Exception for general accumulo failures.

        public void setAutoFlush(boolean autoFlush)
        Description copied from interface: EPGMGraphInput

        Specified by:
        setAutoFlush in interface EPGMGraphInput
        Parameters:
        autoFlush - true to enable auto flush, false to disable

      • dropTables

        public void dropTables()
                throws IOException
        Drop all tables used by this store instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - when deleting tables fails.

      • truncateTables

        public void truncateTables()
                    throws IOException
        Truncate all tables handled by this store instance, i.e. delete all rows. The current implementations simply drops all tables and creates new ones.
        Throws:
        IOException - when deleting or creating tables fails.
